meanings.definition: The range of frequencies within a given band, in particular that used for transmitting a signal.
meanings.sent1: The radio station needed to adjust its bandwidths to improve the sound quality.
meanings.sent2: Our internet provider offers different bandwidths for various connection speeds.
meanings.sent3: The musician's guitar had such wide bandwidths that it could play any note.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had bandwidths that reached far beyond the limits of imagination.
meanings.sent5: The colorful spectrum of bandwidths painted a vivid picture of sound frequencies.

meanings.definition: The capacity for data transfer of a particular communication channel.
meanings.sent1: The new fiber optic cables greatly increased the company's bandwidths for faster data transfer.
meanings.sent2: Streaming services require high bandwidths to deliver movies and shows without buffering.
meanings.sent3: The office's coffee machine had such limited bandwidths that it took ages to brew a single cup.
meanings.sent4: His brain seemed to have infinite bandwidths, processing information at lightning speed.
meanings.sent5: The bandwidths of the internet highway determined how quickly data could travel from one point to another.
